summary: Netflix(NFLX) has recently been on Zacks list of the most searched stocks . Over the past month, shares of this internet video service have returned +9.3%, compared to the Zacks S&P 500 composite's +5.3% change . The key question now is: What could be the stock's future direction?  For the current quarter, Netflix is expected to post earnings of $7.05 per share, indicating a change of +44.5% from the year-ago quarter . The Zacks Consensus Estimate has changed 0% over the last 30 days . For the next fiscal year, the consensus earnings estimate of $30.60 per share has remained unchanged .  Over the past month, the estimate has changed +0.3% from what Netflix is expected to report a year ago . The Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) for Netflix is a more conclusive indicator of a stock's near-term price performance . The chart below shows the evolution of the company's forward 12-month consensus EPS estimate .  Netflix reported revenues of $10.54 billion in the last quarter, representing a year-over-year change of +12.5% EPS of $6.61 for the same period compares with $5.28 a year ago . The company beat consensus estimates in each of the trailing four quarters .  The Zacks Value Style Score organizes stocks into five groups ranging from A to F . Netflix is graded D on this front, indicating that it is trading at a premium to its peers .  Netflix's Zacks Rank #2 suggests that it may outperform the broader market in the near term . The company's Z-Z Rank does suggest that its Z-2 ranking may help investors pay attention to Netflix .

Amazon's constant innovation is a hallmark of a business that will still be around in 50 years . Netflix is a highly profitable entertainment business that is still finding new avenues of growth . Amazon generated $21 billion infree cash flowon $650 billion of revenue over the last year .  Amazon continues to push the limits of delivery speeds . In Q1, it set a new record for items delivered the same or next day . Amazon's investments in robotics are strengthening its competitive advantage in a $4 trillion global e-commerce market .  Analysts expect the company's earnings to grow at an annualized rate of 17% in the coming years . Amazon has a lot of levers it can pull to create shareholder returns . Netflix has evolved from a DVD-by-mail rental service to a dominant streaming service .  Analysts expect Netflix's earnings to grow at an annualized rate of 22% over the next several years . Netflix's strong brand and high-margin business have the makings of a stock that is going to reward shareholders for many years .  The Motley Fool's total average return is789% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to172% for the S&P 500 . Consider when Netflixmade this list on December 17, 2004... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation,you’d have $668,538!  Two Growth Stocks to Buy and Hold Forever: Netflix and Amazon . Netflix is one of the top growth companies in the U.S. market .

Streaming giant Netflix(NFLX) has been taking on all comers over the years . TheStreet Pro's Stephen Guilfoyleremembers those early days when he took short positions on Netflix .  Guilfoyle: "How could Netflix have not been overpriced as those kinds of players entered into an arena that had been dominated by one name?" The veteran trader spent weeks managing risk, doing his best to minimize the damage . Gradually he learned to avoid shorting Netflix .  "That said, I haven't shorted Netflix as an investment for years now. That was a lesson painfully learned," Guilfoyle said . "Much to my amazement, Netflix is still the king of streaming entertainment as legacy media continues to rot from within"  The stock closed June 5 regular trading up 0.9% at $1,250.52 . Shares of Netflix are up about 41% in 2025 and have nearly doubled (up 93%) from a year ago . "Would I buy the shares if there were to be a period of consolidation?" he asks .  Netflix is facing a "very large" total addressable market of $650 billion-plus global entertainment revenue . Evercore ISI raised its price target on Netflix to $1,350 and affirmed an outperform rating following US and UK survey work .  Evercore says Netflix has an "extremely strong and growing value proposition" and an "excellent track record of innovation" Netflix's business model has been inflecting up with wider operating margins and more free cash flow, enabling it to buy back shares and eventually pay a dividend . "In the event of a recession, Netflix's $7.99 ad-supported offering might be the single greatest entertainment value"

Stockholders at Walmart and PayPal voted down proposals related to diversity, equity, and inclusion proposals . Walmart investors voted down a measure that would have required the company to analyze the risks of its charitable contributions . PayPal investors roundly rejected a proposal that would require disclosures on the impact of PayPal's charitable giving .  Walmart has faced some repudiation for making changes to its own DEI policies . More than 30 shareholders representing $266 billion in assets sent a message earlier this year to CEO Doug McMillon that called the retailer's DEI policy changes "very disheartening"  Dozens of companies this year have faced DEI proposals on both sides of the issue . Dozens have proactively announced about-faces on diversity . Tractor Supply CEO Hal Lawtontold Yahoo Financethat its goal in making changes to its DEI policies was to “remove" itself "from any sort of discourse that people viewed to be political or social in its orientation"  Target posted a 3.8% year-over-year decline in same-store sales in the first quarter . Foot traffic at Costco continued to outperform in the last week of May . Walmart has affirmed its support for DEI policies .  "We want everyone that works for the company to be excited about being here, and that's what we'll continue to work towards," McMillon said . McMillon: "Our goal is to be a Walmart for everyone"
